name: Van Gogh (and Theo) Quiz | Vincent van Gogh | 10 Questions

questions.text: A short time prior to his birth, Van Gogh's parents endured a great trauma. What was it?
questions.correct: The death of an infant child
questions.explanation:
The death of an infant child.

	The first child born to the parents, Vincent Van Gogh, was stillborn. The man we know as Vincent Van Gogh was born one year later.

questions.text: Van Gogh had a particularly close relationship with Theo. Which statement describes Theo accurately?
questions.correct: He was Van Gogh's younger brother
options: He was Van Gogh's older brother
questions.explanation:
He was Van Gogh's younger brother.

	Vincent was closer to Theo than to any of his other siblings (and, possibly, closer to Theo than to anyone else in his life).

questions.text: Van Gogh's father was engaged in what line of work?
questions.explanation:
Minister.

	Van Gogh's father was a minister; the religious upbringing carried over into Vincent's life. (At one point, he attempted to enter a school of theology.)

questions.text: Where did Theo work in order to earn a living?
questions.explanation:
Art Gallery.

	Theo shared Van Gogh's interest in art and worked in a gallery in Paris.

questions.text: As a young man, Van Gogh lived for a period of time in a poor community, trying to provide assistance to the residents. What type of community was it?
questions.explanation:
Coal Mining.

	Van Gogh tried to help the poor people who lived in a coal mining community; his art often reflects the hard life of these people.

questions.text: Van Gogh is closely associated with which of these artists?
questions.explanation:
Gauguin.

	It was following a fight with Gauguin (who lived with him at the time) that Van Gogh cut off his ear.

questions.text: One of Van Gogh's early masterpieces showed various people consuming what type of food?
questions.explanation:
Potatoes.

	One of Vincent's early masterpieces is "The Potato Eaters".

questions.text: It has often been said that Van Gogh sold only one painting during his lifetime. Which painting was it?
questions.explanation:
The Red Vineyards.

	Al of the choices mentioned are paintings by Van Gog; "Sunflowers" and "Starry Night" are particularly well -known. It was "vineyards", however, that Theo sold (via his gallery) for Vincent.

Gunshot wound.

	After great trials and tribulations in a stormy life, it is believed that Van Gogh shot himself.

questions.text: How old was Van Gogh when he died?
questions.explanation:
In his 30s.

	Van Gogh died at 37. It was a short life filled with talent - but also filled with great physical and emotional pain.
